entry.title: For a breath I tarry
entry.content: 眼泪？沉默。From far, from eve and morningAnd yon twelve-winded skyThe stuff of life to knit meBlew hither: here am I.Now, for a breath I tarryNor yet disperse apartTake my hand quick and tell meWhat have you in your heart. Speak now, and I will answerHow shall I help you, sayEre to the wind’s twelve quartersI take my endless way.
